message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CV. 

The paper proposes a new approach to reinforcement learning that focuses on robustness and stability in the face of disturbances and differences between training and test scenarios. This is a topic that is relevant to several sub-fields within computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), robotics (cs.RO), systems and control (cs.SY), and computer vision (cs.CV). Given the focus on deep neural networks and policy learning, as well as the use of simulation environments and experiments with physical systems, cs.LG and cs.AI seem like the most likely categories. However, the emphasis on control and stability suggests that cs.RO and cs.SY are also relevant, while the use of visual inputs and the focus on locomotion tasks could make cs.CV a possible category as well.
